snippet: Sabirhan Hasanoff, formerly of Brooklyn, had helped Al Qaeda since at least November 2007, when he accepted $50,000 from an unidentified co-conspirator, prosecutors said.
abstract: Sabirhan Hasanoff, a dual citizen of the United States and Australia and former Brooklyn resident, pleads guilty to providing material support to Al Qaeda; Hasanoff has helped the terrorist group since at least November 2007 and is accused of providing computer advice and other assistance.
lead_paragraph: Sabirhan Hasanoff, formerly of Brooklyn, had helped Al Qaeda since at least November 2007, when he accepted $50,000 from an unidentified co-conspirator, prosecutors said.

headline.seo: Sabirhan Hasanoff Pleads Guilty to Qaeda Support
headline.main: A Guilty Plea to Giving Aid to Al Qaeda Since 2007
headline.print_headline: Ex-Brooklyn Man Pleads Guilty to Giving Aid to Al Qaeda Since 2007
